Auto-Skeleton Loader

@townhall-gg/skeleton

Wrap your UI and it automatically becomes a skeleton while loading. No manual skeleton components needed!

pnpm
add @townhall-gg/skeleton

Auto-toggles every 3 seconds

Features

Zero Configuration

Just wrap your component with <Skeleton loading> and it works. No manual skeleton creation needed.

Preserves Layout

Your actual DOM structure is preserved. Text becomes gray bars of the same size, images become rectangles.

Smooth Animations

Choose between pulse or wave animations. Both respect prefers-reduced-motion for accessibility.

Fully Customizable

Override colors, timing, and border radius via props or CSS variables. Works in light and dark modes.

Accessible

Adds aria-busy and aria-live attributes. Disables pointer events during loading state.

Tiny Bundle

< 1KB JavaScript + CSS. No dependencies besides React. Tree-shakeable exports.

Quick Start

import { Skeleton } from "@townhall-gg/skeleton";
import "@townhall-gg/skeleton/styles.css";

function UserCard({ user, isLoading }) {
  return (
    <Skeleton loading={isLoading}>
      <div className="card">
        <img src={user?.avatar} alt="Avatar" />
        <h2>{user?.name || "Loading..."}</h2>
        <p>{user?.bio || "Bio placeholder"}</p>
        <button>Follow</button>
      </div>
    </Skeleton>
  );
}

// That's it! When loading={true}:
// - Text becomes gray pulsing bars
// - Images become gray rectangles
// - Buttons become skeleton shapes
// - Layout is preserved perfectly
